nodes.bodyText: Nit: synchronize this for consistency (so that all access to the underlying List is threadsafe).

Should we also expose a delete method on the TemporaryProviderConfig class so that it can drop the provider ID from the List? Otherwise we'd be making an extra rpc to delete an already deleted provider config.
Okay sure, but we will need to synchronize on the list instead of synchronizing on the method in order to ensure that we don't try to create and delete at the same time.
I'd go for simplicity and just synchronize all the methods that modify the ID List. Performance issue should not really concern at this scale, especially for a test case.
This wasn't a performance optimization. We have to synchronize on the ID list or else we may run into concurrency issues if we delete and add to the list at the same time.
Ah it turns out that I misunderstood how the synchronized keyword worked on methods!
Nit: I kindda liked the more descriptive name tenantAwareAuth here. But your call.
Use the tempProviderConfig here and unroll the try-finally?
